docs.title: Documentation
docs.subtitle: Everything you need to build on NeoHub
docs.comingSoonDesc: We are currently updating our documentation for the {section} section.

intro.welcome: Welcome to NeoHub, the next-generation MiniApp platform built on Neo N3. NeoHub provides a secure, high-performance execution environment for decentralized applications, leveraging Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) to provide hardware-level isolation for your data and secrets.
intro.secureDesc: Every MiniApp runs in an isolated enclave, protected by Intel SGX. Secrets never leave the hardware.
intro.identityDesc: Social login and wallet connectivity work together seamlessly to provide a frictionless user experience.
intro.whatIsDesc: NeoHub is more than just a marketplace; it's a full-stack infrastructure for decentralized apps. It abstracts away the complexities of blockchain interaction while providing developers with powerful services out-of-the-box, such as hardware-based random number generation, secure data oracles, and automated task execution.
intro.didYouKnowDesc: NeoHub uses the same security standards as top-tier financial institutions to ensure your transactions and private keys are always protected.

userSteps.title: Connect Your Wallet
userSteps.desc: Use NeoLine, O3, or OneGate to identify yourself on the platform.

userSteps.title: Link Your Socials
userSteps.desc: Connect Google or X to recover your account and sync across devices.

userSteps.title: Explore MiniApps
userSteps.desc: Launch any app from our marketplace with zero installation required.

quickstart.installSdk: Install the NeoHub SDK to begin building your own MiniApps.
quickstart.initSdk: Initialize the SDK in your project:
quickstart.playgroundDesc: The fastest way to experiment with our APIs without writing a single line of code.

auth.subtitle: Secure entry and identity management on NeoHub.
auth.comparisonDesc: NeoHub provides a unique dual-authentication system. While users can log in via social media (Google, X, GitHub) for convenience, certain high-security actions still require a connected Neo wallet.
auth.tipDesc: We recommend connecting both a social account and a wallet. This ensures you can always recover access to your profile even if you lose access to one of your credentials.

apiKeys.subtitle: Managing access to NeoHub services for your applications.
apiKeys.createDesc: To use NeoHub services from outside our host application (e.g., in a standalone web app or backend), you'll need an API Key. You can generate these in your Account Settings.
apiKeys.warningDesc: Your API keys grant access to your platform features and potentially your service funds. Never commit them to version control or share them in public forums.

securityModel.subtitle: The philosophy and technical implementation of protection on NeoHub.
securityModel.isolationDesc: The cornerstone of our security is the **Trusted Execution Environment**. Unlike traditional cloud platforms where the OS admin can see all data, NeoHub uses hardware enclaves (Intel SGX) that encrypt data even while it's being processed in the CPU.
securityModel.zeroDesc: We cannot see your secrets, private keys, or the internal state of your secure functions.
securityModel.attestationDesc: Every piece of code running on the platform can be verified to be the exact code intended, with no tampering.

architecture.subtitle: Deep dive into the architectural foundations of the {title}.
architecture.howItWorksDesc: The {title} provides the fundamental security guarantees for the entire platform. By utilizing hardware-level isolation, we ensure that even if the host machine is compromised, the data inside the enclave remains completely encrypted and inaccessible.
architecture.integrityDesc: Ensures that the code being executed is exactly what was deployed, with cryptographic proofs.
architecture.confidentialityDesc: Data is only accessible to authorized code within the secure enclave. No leakage to the host OS.

teeRoot.subtitle: The hardware-based anchor for all security guarantees on NeoHub.
teeRoot.howItWorks: At the lowest level, NeoHub leverages Intel SGX (Software Guard Extensions) to create private regions of memory called enclaves. These enclaves are isolated from the rest of the system, including the operating system and hypervisor. The CPU hardware itself manages the encryption and access control.
teeRoot.integrity: Hardware-level measurements ensure that only the exact, byte-for-byte authorized binary can be loaded into the enclave.
teeRoot.confidentiality: All data inside the enclave is encrypted while in RAM, only becoming plaintext inside the CPU package itself.

serviceOS.subtitle: A minimal, secure execution layer optimized for TEE environments.
serviceOS.howItWorks: The ServiceOS is a custom-built, hardened supervisor that runs inside the enclave. It provides essential services like secure networking, encrypted storage, and capability-based access control to MiniApps while maintaining a minimal attack surface.
serviceOS.integrity: The ServiceOS is cryptographically signed and verified by the TEE Root during every boot sequence.
serviceOS.confidentiality: Inter-process communication within the ServiceOS is encrypted and isolated using hardware-enforced boundaries.

capabilities.subtitle: Fine-grained permission management for NeoHub services.
capabilities.howItWorks: NeoHub uses a capability-based security model. Instead of broad permissions, each MiniApp is granted specific 'capabilities' (tokens of authority) to access platform services like the Oracle or VRF. This ensures the principle of least privilege is strictly enforced.
capabilities.integrity: Capability tokens are cryptographically bound to the MiniApp identity and cannot be forged or transferred.
capabilities.confidentiality: The list of granted capabilities is stored within the secure enclave state, invisible to external observers.

services.subtitle: Learn how to leverage our {title} service in your applications.
services.overviewDesc: The {title} service is a core component of NeoHub, providing high-reliability data streams and verifiable results for every MiniApp. It eliminates the need for third-party oracle networks by integrating directly into the TEE layer.
services.realTimeDesc: This service has processed over 1.2M verified requests in the last 24 hours with 100% uptime.

oracle.subtitle: Secure external data fetching with secret injection capabilities.
oracle.overview: The Oracle Service (NeoOracle) enables MiniApps to securely fetch external data from any HTTP endpoint while injecting encrypted secrets. All requests are processed within Intel SGX enclaves, ensuring your API keys and credentials never leave the hardware.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.desc: Custom headers to include in the request.

parameters.name: secretRefs
parameters.desc: List of secret keys to be injected into headers/body.

vrf.subtitle: Cryptographically secure verifiable random number generation.
vrf.overview: The VRF Service (NeoVRF) provides provably fair random numbers using ECDSA P-256 signing. Each random value comes with a cryptographic proof that can be verified on-chain, making it perfect for gaming, lotteries, and any application requiring trustless randomness.
features: Optional on-chain anchoring via RandomnessLog contract

parameters.name: seed
parameters.desc: A unique value to ensure randomness uniqueness.

secrets.subtitle: Secure credential storage with hardware-level encryption.
secrets.overview: The Secrets Service provides encrypted storage for sensitive credentials like API keys, private keys, and tokens. Secrets are sealed to the SGX enclave and can only be decrypted by authorized MiniApps during TEE execution.

parameters.name: allowedApps
parameters.desc: IDs of apps authorized to use this secret.

secrets.pricing: Free for up to 10 secrets, then 1,000 GAS/month per secret

datafeeds.subtitle: Real-time price feeds aggregated from multiple sources.
datafeeds.overview: The DataFeeds Service (NeoFeeds) provides reliable price data by aggregating from multiple HTTP sources and computing the median. Data is signed by the TEE and anchored to the PriceFeed smart contract for on-chain verification.

automation.subtitle: Trigger-based task scheduling and execution.
automation.overview: The Automation Service enables scheduled and event-driven task execution via PostgreSQL-based task management with Vercel Cron. Define triggers based on time intervals or schedules, and tasks will execute automatically.

parameters.name: action
parameters.desc: The action to perform (HTTP, Smart Contract call).

gasbank.subtitle: Prepaid GAS account for seamless service usage.
gasbank.overview: The GasBank Service manages your GAS balance for platform services. Deposit GAS to your account and services will automatically deduct fees, eliminating the need for per-transaction approvals.
features: Deposit verification from Neo N3 chain

parameters.name: txHash
parameters.desc: Neo N3 transaction hash for verification.

mixer.subtitle: Privacy-preserving transaction mixing service.
mixer.overview: The Mixer Service provides transaction privacy by breaking the on-chain link between sender and receiver. Using zero-knowledge proofs processed within the TEE, your transaction history remains confidential.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.desc: Amount to mix (must match pool denomination).

ccip.subtitle: Cross-chain interoperability protocol.
ccip.overview: The CCIP Service enables secure cross-chain communication and asset transfers. Bridge assets between Neo N3 and other supported chains with TEE-verified message passing.

restApi.subtitle: RESTful API endpoints for all NeoHub services.

websocket.subtitle: Real-time data streaming via WebSocket.

errors.subtitle: Standard error codes and their meanings.

codes.400: Bad Request - Invalid parameters or missing required fields.
codes.401: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing API key in Authorization header.
codes.403: Forbidden - The API key does not have permission for the requested service.
codes.404: Not Found - The requested resource or endpoint does not exist.
codes.429: Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded. Please wait before retrying.
codes.500: Internal Error - An unexpected error occurred on the NeoHub server.

limits.subtitle: Rate limits and quotas for API usage.

tiers.enterprise: Custom limits tailored to your needs

jsSDK.subtitle: Official TypeScript/JavaScript SDK for NeoHub.
features: Full TypeScript support with comprehensive typings

goSDK.subtitle: Official Go SDK for high-performance backend services.
goSDK.example:
import "github.com/R3E-Network/neohub-go"

client := neohub.NewClient("your-api-key")
price, err := client.DataFeeds.GetPrice(ctx, "BTC-USD")
if err != nil {
    log.Fatal(err)
}
fmt.Printf("Price: %f\n", price.Value)

pythonSDK.subtitle: Official Python SDK for data science and automation.
features: Direct Pandas integration for historical data
Type hints for excellent IDE integration
pythonSDK.example:
from neohub import NeoHub
import asyncio

async def main():
    hub = NeoHub(api_key='your-api-key')
    price = await hub.datafeeds.get_price('BTC-USD')
    print(f"BTC: {price.value}")

asyncio.run(main())

cli.subtitle: Command-line interface for NeoHub operations.
commands: neohub login - Authenticate with your platform account
neohub deploy <path> - Deploy a MiniApp to the platform
neohub logs <app-id> - View real-time logs for your app
neohub secrets set <key> <value> - Manage your secure credentials
neohub stats - View usage statistics and billing
cli.example:
# Create and deploy your first app
neohub init my-app
cd my-app
neohub deploy . --main index.js

tee.footer: Hardware-grade security confirmed by Intel SGX Enclave

features: Provably fair draws using VRF randomness
steps: Select the number of tickets to purchase
Wait for the draw - winners are selected automatically
Prizes are sent directly to winning wallets
lottery.tips: Buy multiple tickets to increase your chances. Check the jackpot size before participating.

features: Double your GAS on correct prediction
steps: Enter your bet amount in GAS
Result is revealed instantly - winnings auto-deposited
coinflip.tips: Start with small bets to understand the game mechanics.

steps: Set your winning range (e.g., 1-50 out of 100)
Watch the dice roll - payouts based on your odds
dicegame.tips: Wider ranges have lower payouts but higher win probability.

scratchcard.tips: Higher tier cards have bigger potential prizes.

steps: Join or create a poker table
secretpoker.tips: Your cards remain private until showdown thanks to ZK proofs.

steps: Place your bet before round starts
Miss the crash and lose your bet
neocrash.tips: Set auto cash-out for consistent strategy.

steps: Pay with GAS to claim ownership
millionpiecemap.tips: Prime locations near popular areas are more valuable.

neoswap.tips: Check slippage settings for large trades.

flashloan.tips: Flash loans must be repaid in the same transaction or they revert.

compoundcapsule.tips: Longer deposits benefit more from compounding.

selfloan.tips: Self-loans let you access liquidity without selling your assets.

neoburger.tips: bNEO can be used in other DeFi protocols while earning rewards.

steps: Recipients use your GAS for fees
gassponsor.tips: Great for onboarding new users who don't have GAS yet.

grantshare.tips: Detailed proposals with clear milestones get more votes.

redenvelope.tips: Random distribution adds excitement to group gifts.

devtipping.tips: Regular small tips help sustain open source development.

steps: Click on canvas to place pixel
Pay small GAS fee per pixel
canvas.tips: Coordinate with others to create larger artworks.

timecapsule.tips: Perfect for future self-reminders or gifts.

gardenofneo.tips: Consistent daily care yields the best rewards.

graveyard.tips: Memorials are permanent and cannot be deleted.

govbooster.tips: Boosted votes have more influence on outcomes.

burnleague.tips: Strategic timing can maximize your ranking.

steps: Stake GAS to push back clock
doomsdayclock.tips: Watch the clock closely near zero.

masqueradedao.tips: Your vote is private but verifiable.

steps: Vote if you're a council member
councilgovernance.tips: Only council members can vote on proposals.

steps: Enter transaction hash, block, or address
explorer.tips: Bookmark addresses you want to monitor.

unbreakablevault.tips: Longer time-locks provide better security against hacks.
